page.title: 11FORESTRY IN SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: The main part of Shillingstone Hill was planted with Beech,Oak,Spruce Fir,Douglas Fir,Corsican Pine and Scots Pine approximately 30 years ago.There are areas of Oak woodland left for conservation,which provide a natural habitat for wildlife. The deer in these woods are Roe,Sika,Fallow and a few Munjac (Chinese Water deer).These are culled throughout the shooting season. Pheasant shooting has greatly improved sinse the thinning of the woods.Buzzards have bred here and can be seen over Shillingstone. Most of the woods in the area are owned and managed by the the Forestry Commission.There are many walks and picnic areas.A large number of people are employed in thinning and felling the timber.
